p: Table 2. showed that δ-3-carene (43.10%), (+)-cedrol (74.03%) and camphor (21.23%) were the major constituents of the essential oils of C. decurrens, C. sempervirens and T. articulata, respectively. In addition alpha- fenchyl acetate (14.16%) and α- fenchol (13.07%) were predominant in essential oil of C. decurrens; α-pinene (4.60%) and δ-3-carene (3.80%) were dominated in essential oil of C. sempervirens and T. articulata essential oil showed the presence of bornyl acetate and and (+)-fenchol in a percentage of 15.03% and 13.85%, respectively.
